solution_line_template: Julio has {julio_orange_bottles} * {liters_per_bottle} = <<{julio_orange_bottles}*{liters_per_bottle}={julio_orange_liters}>>{julio_orange_liters} liters of orange soda
Julio also has {julio_grape_bottles} * {liters_per_bottle} = <<{julio_grape_bottles}*{liters_per_bottle}={julio_grape_liters}>>{julio_grape_liters} liters of grape soda.
Julio therefore has a total of {julio_orange_liters} + {julio_grape_liters} = <<{julio_orange_liters}+{julio_grape_liters}={julio_total_liters}>>{julio_total_liters} liters of soda

The amount of orange soda that Mateo has is {mateo_orange_bottles} * {liters_per_bottle} = <<{mateo_orange_bottles}*{liters_per_bottle}={mateo_orange_liters}>>{mateo_orange_liters} liters of orange soda
In addition, Mateo has {mateo_grape_bottles} * {liters_per_bottle} = <<{mateo_grape_bottles}*{liters_per_bottle}={mateo_grape_liters}>>{mateo_grape_liters} liters of grape soda.
In total, Mateo has {mateo_orange_liters} + {mateo_grape_liters} = <<{mateo_orange_liters}+{mateo_grape_liters}={mateo_total_liters}>>{mateo_total_liters} liters of soda.
This means that Julio has {julio_total_liters} - {mateo_total_liters} = <<{julio_total_liters}-{mateo_total_liters}={difference_in_liters}>>{difference_in_liters} liters more of soda
